tweet: b'Captain Dimitris and the crew from the MY SOLANDGE surprised us with a fireworks show! https://t.co/ggH07SZhNT'
b'https://t.co/vN815jAZBm'
b'We are having a blast in Greece! We all got festive for our soul train line tonight and busted a move or two \xf0\x9f\x98\x82 https://t.co/o0taf6ZTWM'
b'I loved the beautiful Skorpios Island! https://t.co/uCHq831c77'
b'From the culture, to the history and the food, everything has been exceptional! The people have welcomed Cookie, me, and our friends with open arms.'

b'I had the honor and pleasure of getting a surprise call from the Prime Minister of Greece Kyriakos Mitsotakis welcoming me to the country and seeing how my visit has been so far. I told the Prime Minister it\xe2\x80\x99s been amazing and life changing!'

b'We enjoyed a beautiful dinner last night at Komis Fish Tavern in Zakynthos, Greece with our friends Richard and Tina Lawson, Simone and Todd Smith, LaTanya and Sam Jackson, and Vicki and John Palmer! https://t.co/jqAJfH3elz'
b'Cookie and I in Corinth Canal. Running 4 miles long, it was completed in the 1890s connecting the Gulf of Corinth in the Ionian Sea with the Saronic Gulf in the Aegean Sea! https://t.co/pT60juTrkF'

b'Many of the original buildings of the Acropolis were destroyed or repurposed. After Rome converted to Christianity in the 6th century AD many Acropolis temples became Christian churches. It was eye-opening to learn about the history of the city & gain so much biblical context! https://t.co/ypepoRYS5n'
b'the Propylaea, the Temple of Athena Nike built in 431 BC, the Temple of the Maidens (Erechtheion), and the Odeon of Herodes Theater built in 174 AD. https://t.co/WeHKKlWPTq'

b'Today I had a life changing experience filled with so much biblical history. We visited the Acropolis of Athens, a fortified citadel located on the top of a hill with four Temples. We saw historical landmarks including the Parthenon dedicated to Athena the Virgin in 447 BC, https://t.co/MCaaKArp5S'
b'Having some fun in the Mediterranean Sea! https://t.co/gh4cqUqr3I'

b'With these free agent signings, the @Lakers have become younger and more athletic! I\xe2\x80\x99m excited about the signing of Thomas Bryant. With his ability to shoot the 3, he will create more space for LeBron and AD.'
b'I love Lonnie Walker because he\xe2\x80\x99s big, strong and athletic. The @Lakers also made some great additions to the roster with Troy Brown Jr., Juan Toscano-Anderson and Damian Jones!'
b'https://t.co/QshLcTgxdQ'
b'Cookie and I at the famous Church of Three Bells of Fira in the beautiful city Santorini! Behind us you can see a volcano. https://t.co/5pUhpyOdZu'
b'https://t.co/D7RBe4WPJq'
b'Cookie and I want to wish everyone a Happy Fourth of July from Greece! https://t.co/AephZmUqdC'
b'I want to wish Rob Pelinka and the @Lakers the best of luck in free agency!'

b'God is so good! Excited to have met Anais in Orlando, FL & learn more about her desire to continue her education. Yesterday I met with her again; she\xe2\x80\x99s so smart & intelligent, I\xe2\x80\x99m thrilled to personally help her get to college & see all that she will accomplish! https://t.co/bv1kYwWl6l'
b'I had so much fun and the audience had a great time participating as I took them through my basketball life and business journey.'

b'I want to thank Advent International Managing Partner and Co-Founder Bryan Taylor for allowing me to speak to Advent professionals from around the world today at a packed ballroom in Miami! The audience represented countries like Germany, Belgium, Lithuania, and the UK.'
b'Jesse and Joey Buss have always done a great job developing players like Alex Caruso and Austin Reaves; they\xe2\x80\x99ll do the same with Max.'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99m excited about the @Lakers draft pick MSU\xe2\x80\x99s Max Christie! He can play multiple positions, is an excellent defender, has a high basketball IQ, and has a beautiful jump shot. Max just needs to get stronger and work on his ball handling.'

b'Sending prayers to a good friend and someone I\xe2\x80\x99ve worked with for over 30 years, Chaka Zulu. He was shot and wounded last night. \xf0\x9f\x99\x8f\xf0\x9f\x8f\xbe\xf0\x9f\x99\x8f\xf0\x9f\x8f\xbe\xf0\x9f\x99\x8f\xf0\x9f\x8f\xbe'

b'I was very happy to see one of the track and field \xf0\x9f\x90\x90s  Allyson Felix compete this past weekend in the USATF Outdoor Championships! Best of luck and many blessings to you in life after track and field @allysonfelix!'
b'And congratulations to all of the winning track and field athletes this weekend!! What an incredible event!'
b'It was a big upset in the women\xe2\x80\x99s 100M with Coastal Carolina\xe2\x80\x99s Melissa Jefferson beating Aleia Hobbs. Congratulations @Melissajanae21!'
b'It\xe2\x80\x99s good to see Rai Benjamin back after battling COVID. He was back to his old ways again winning the 400M Hurdles! @_Kingben_'
b'I\xe2\x80\x99ve never seen Fred Kerley run that fast before in the 100M race. He was blazing at 9.76 seconds! @fkerley99'
b'The fireworks really started after the race. I love the competitive spirit of Erriyon Knighton. He was so mad after he didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to do an interview after the race. @ErriyonK'
b'The race of the day was the men\xe2\x80\x99s 200M when Noah Lyles walked down the High School sensation Erriyon Knighton and edged him right at the tape. What a race! WOW WOW WOW!! @LylesNoah'

b"Athing Mu had a dominating 800M performance. Her smile reminds me of mine and we both have a love for our craft! She took the world by storm winning the gold medal at 19 in the 800M and it looks like she's on track to do the same thing at the world championship. @athiiing"

b'World record-holder Keni Harrison also ran a world lead 12.34 second 100M hurdle race. Keni is one of my favorite track and field athletes. She\xe2\x80\x99s serious about her craft and it paid off this weekend. That\xe2\x80\x99s why she\xe2\x80\x99s a champion! @Ken_AYE_'

b'It was fun to watch Michael Norman get his swagger and confidence back. I\xe2\x80\x99ve been watching him ever since he was at SC and his 43.56 400M performance was out of this world! He ran a world lead and broke the Hayward Field record. @Mike_Norman22'

b'Abby Steiner won the 200M race with a world lead and personal best time of 21.77 seconds! Abby\xe2\x80\x99s win is so amazing because she\xe2\x80\x99s still in college at the University of Kentucky. @abbysteiner1'

b'Congratulations to Sydney McLaughlin for breaking her own world record in the 400M hurdles at 51.41 seconds! What\xe2\x80\x99s amazing about Sydney is she runs with such ease. The great ones always make it look easy even when they dominate. @GoSydGo'
b'If you missed this weekend, you missed one of the most exciting sporting events this year, the USATF Outdoor Championships on NBC!'

b'I had a great morning speaking in San Diego at Connections 2022 to over 400 attendees. We had an engaging conversation about my life on the basketball court and in business! Thank you to SMC3 CEO & President Andrew Slusher for having me today! https://t.co/6WkQrqH4an'
b'Throwback! https://t.co/tyYuQrCi0J'
b'It was an amazing conference given by Co-Founder and CEO of Traffic Sales and Profit Lamar Tyler. Thank you for having me!'

b'I had a great time today at TSP Live 2022 speaking to over 3,000 Black entrepreneurs. I was just happy to see so many men and women of color who owned their own business and provided them tools on how to grow and take their companies to the next level! https://t.co/2CcdXs9cs4'
b'Thank you to NAA\xe2\x80\x99s Chairman of the Board Don Brunner and Karen Brunner for having me. It was outstanding and a true blessing!'

b'Today was a unique opportunity to speak at the 2022 National Apartment Association conference because I use to own a lot of apartment buildings back in the day. I spoke in front of over 6,000 people about business strategy and doing business in today\xe2\x80\x99a marketplace. https://t.co/0nO6BCPrgW'
b'I want to thank Robert at Tom Ford! I love this suit, especially the color!! https://t.co/fv1ZKIqUu5'
b'and her HollyRod Foundation helps people with autism and Parkinson\xe2\x80\x99s Disease. God continues to bless her and use her and we are so proud of the work she is doing!'

b'What a terrific day it was for Cookie and me to see our friend for over 35 years, Holly Robinson Peete, get her star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame this afternoon! She\xe2\x80\x99s not only a superstar actress, she\xe2\x80\x99s also a philanthropist (1/2) https://t.co/DiiB0P3rQ5'

b'we collectively use our voice. We have midterm elections happening this year and it\xe2\x80\x99s important that we utilize our freedom and right to vote to ensure we have leaders that will truly fight for us.'

b'Juneteenth is the oldest commemoration of the end of slavery in the U.S. & beginning of freedom for many African Americans. While we still have a lot of work to do, the national recognition of this holiday is a step forward & a representation of what happens when'

b'Back home in Michigan this weekend to celebrate Father\xe2\x80\x99s Day and my father turning 88 years old with Cookie,  my siblings Larry, Michael, Kim, Evelyn, Pearl, and my brother Larry\xe2\x80\x99s wife Jennifer. We enjoyed a great fish fry and barbecue! https://t.co/5Y3cf9jWHW'
b'Congratulations to Hall of Famer and Dodger legend Sandy Koufax on the unveiling of his statue in front of @Dodgers Stadium yesterday! https://t.co/bBMNOfjcUE'
b'Happy Juneteenth!'
b'Happy Father\xe2\x80\x99s Day to all of the fathers around the world! I hope you have a blessed day.'
b'I want to thank SMB Team CEO Bill Hauser and CMO Andy Stickel for having me!'

b'Today I did a virtual speaking engagement for SMB Team and was on with some of the smartest and brightest lawyers from around the country who are also entrepreneurs. I had a good time sharing business strategies and giving them tips on how to grow their business.'
b'GSW Head Coach Steve Kerr is on my Mount Rushmore of NBA coaches with Pat Riley, Phil Jackson, Red Auerbach and Greg Popovich.'
b'Congratulations to Golden State owners Joe Lacob and my good friend and business partner Peter Guber on winning another NBA Championship!'

b'Thank you @StephenCurry30 for entertaining us and putting on one of the best performances in NBA Finals history!! We all enjoyed watching you play my brother! Congratulations on your 4th NBA Championship and first NBA Finals MVP!'

b'Happy 88th birthday to my role model, my incredible father Earvin Johnson Sr.! People always ask me who I idolized growing up and I always say it started at home. My father was my first hero and I thank him for giving me my work ethic both on the court and off, https://t.co/naOzyTrOBI'

b'The Celtics dominated in the third quarter and played fantastic basketball, but Jordan Poole stole the momentum from the Celtics when he hit a 3 pointer at the end of the quarter to put them up by one. After that, the Warriors never looked back!'
b'Give the Warriors a lot of credit for their  defense in the fourth quarter. They really shut the Celtics down to earn the victory.'
b'The Warriors were led by Andrew Wiggins tonight, who had 26 points and 13 rebounds! Four other guys ended in double figures: Klay Thompson with 21, Curry 16, Payton 15, and Poole ended with 14.'

b'It was so great to see my friend and former Senior Advisor Valerie Jarrett, Screenwriter and Producer Mara Brock Akil, and creator of the 1619 Project Nikole Hannah-Jones today at the Culture of Democracy Summit! https://t.co/gt8Z4lSOMA'

b'from all around the world to discuss the importance of voting and how we can all come together and play our role in strengthening our democracy through voter education and mobilization. Now is the time to come together and protect our right to vote!'

b'What a great day at the inaugural Culture of Democracy Summit held by our incredible former First Lady Michelle Obama, the Co-Chair and Founder of When We All Vote, at the Banc of California Stadium. Today\xe2\x80\x99s event gathered leaders in their communities https://t.co/drzYP9eWV4'
b'in major projects for our country. We look forward to making this one of the best terminals in America. This is one of many upcoming projects!'

b'Our investment includes a board seat for the project, and gives us a voice moving forward. As a Black-owned infrastructure fund, we are able to open the door for so many minority and women-owned businesses (MWBEs) and reinforce the importance of having MWBE participation'

b'One of the big reasons the Warriors won Game 4, besides Steph going off for 43 points and 10 rebounds, was GSW dominated on the boards 55 to 42.'

b'The Celtics must have thought they were a better three-point shooting team than the Warriors because in the last 6 minutes, every shot was a three pointer, AND they kept missing. That\xe2\x80\x99s why they lost!'
b'I\xe2\x80\x99m looking forward to a triple double from Draymond Green tomorrow!'
b'I think no matter who wins the Golden State vs. Boston series, Steph Curry should be the MVP because he\xe2\x80\x99s been dominant in the first four games!'

I want to personally thank Fred Segal for hosting my beautiful daughter, her team, & company! https://t.co/P3aY1oLJqo'
b'The Celtics couldn\xe2\x80\x99t get out of their own way in the fourth quarter. They kept launching and missing three pointers \xf0\x9f\xa4\xa6\xf0\x9f\x8f\xbf\xe2\x80\x8d\xe2\x99\x82\xef\xb8\x8f'
b'Coach Steve Kerr made a bold move limiting Draymond\xe2\x80\x99s minutes in the fourth quarter. His decision turned out to be good for the Warriors!'

b'When Curry was on the bench in the fourth quarter both Thompson and Wiggins made big plays. Klay Thompson had 5 straight points and Wiggins scored off of 2 crucial offensive rebounds to add 4 points. Then Steph came back in and took over the game!'

b'Steph Curry continues his dominant play putting up 43 points and 10 rebounds to lead the Warriors 107-97 over the Celtics! He got some help tonight from Klay Thompson with 18 points and Wiggins 17 points and 16 rebounds.'

b'I hope that everyone continues to shed light on this situation until Brittney Griner is brought home to her family and loved ones. I pray that she is safe and returned home expeditiously.'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s been 112 days since Brittney Griner was wrongfully detained in Russia. I urge and fully support the efforts of the U.S. Government and NBA Commissioner Adam Silver to bring Brittney home quickly and safely. This is unacceptable!'
b'Klay Thompson finally had a breakout game tonight, that may bode well for the Warriors in Game 4.'
b'Steph Curry put on a show scoring 15 points in the 3rd quarter and finishing with 31 points total. I hope his injury isn\xe2\x80\x99t severe!'
b'Jaylen Brown scored 27 points and 9 rebounds in tonight\xe2\x80\x99s 116-100 win over Golden State.'

b'Their size finally hurt Golden State and they dominated them on the boards, especially on the offensive end. The team finished with 15 offensive rebounds, which led to a lot of second chance points.'
b'Coach Udoka for the Celtics made some major adjustments, including pressure defense. The Celtics were more physical and aggressive than the Warriors tonight.'
b'Big man Robert Williams III had 10 rebounds and 8 points, Al Horford had 11 points, and Grant Williams finished with 10 points.'

b'Superstar Jayson Tatum scored 27 points, but that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t tell his impact on the game tonight. He made everyone on the Celtics better with 9 assists, many of which added to Marcus Smart\xe2\x80\x99s 24 points, and he helped the role players play to their potential.'

b'Today I had a virtual speaking engagement with 3000 Google managers from around the world. What an awesome time! Thank you to Vice President and General Manager of Geo Chris Phillips for having me!'
b'Klay Thompson did not shoot well at home. If the Warriors are to win in Boston, he must shoot better and the Warriors must figure out how to get Wiggins on track offensively.'
b'Last but not least, the Celtics must cut down on their turnovers to win Game 3.'

b'In Game 3, Celtics Coach Udoka will have to make offensive adjustments to free up Tatum and Horford, find a way to get Marcus Smart more looks, and he has to get similar production off his bench from Williams, White, and Pritchard.'
b"Warriors Coach Steve Kerr made outstanding adjustments offensively against the Celtics in Game 2, that's why they won."

b'Thank you to Debbee Dugger and Debbie Erickson for allowing my son, EJ, to have a private 30th birthday party at Magic Mountain amusement park last night. EJ & all of his guests had the time of their lives. They were able to ride their favorite rides over and over again. \xf0\x9f\x8e\x82\xf0\x9f\x8e\xa2\xf0\x9f\x8e\xa1\xf0\x9f\x8e\x81'
b'He won a championship as a coach with the Bucks and as a player with the Pistons. He knows winning and championship basketball!'

b'I am extremely proud of @RepKarenBass for running a positive campaign focusing on pertinent issues in Los Angeles. Rep. Karen Bass would make the best mayor for the City of Los Angeles!'
b'Once again Golden State dominated Dallas on the boards. Tonight they out-rebounded them 47-33.'
b'Golden State Coach Steve Kerr\xe2\x80\x99s game-plan against Dallas has been terrific!  His switching from zone to man-to-man has kept Dallas\xe2\x80\x99s offense off balance.'
b'Another Warrior player playing the best basketball I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever seen him play is Kevon Looney! He had 9 points and 12 rebounds in tonight\xe2\x80\x99s win.'
b'Steph Curry is continuing his phenomenal play with 41 points and 11 assists in tonight\xe2\x80\x99s game.'

b'Andrew Wiggins is playing the best basketball I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever seen him play!! He had the dunk of the year over Doncic and his Playoff high 27 points and 11 rebounds tonight in the Warriors 109-100 victory.'

b'Strus actually hit the biggest shot of the game after Boston cut Miami\xe2\x80\x99s lead to one. Strus hit a three, Bam followed up with a jump shot, and a key steal by Lowery sealed the victory for the Heat.'
b'Miami\xe2\x80\x99s mental and physical toughness willed them to victory tonight against Boston. After losing Jimmy Butler, Bam Adebayo stepped up scoring 31 points, 10 rebounds, and 6 assists.'
b"Will Smith and Austin Barnes also added homeruns in tonight's @Dodgers victory!"

b'Mookie Betts did it all tonight with his bat, glove, and arm in the @Dodgers 7-4 win over the Phillies! He hit a homerun, made a spectacular catch, and threw a man out from third base trying to score at home. That play should be on #SCTop10 tonight!'
b'Golden State takes the 2-0 lead after their 126-117 victory.'

b'The Warriors role players gave them the lead in the last quarter! Coach Kerr gets a lot of credit for starting the fourth with Poole, Moody, Wiggins, Looney and Porter Jr. and sticking with that lineup after trailing most of the game.'

b'Steph Curry took over the game in the fourth quarter ending with 32 points and 8 rebounds! He had a lot of help from Looney scoring 21 points and 12 rebounds, Poole with 23 points, Wiggins 16, Thompson 15, and Porter Jr. with 11 points.'

b'Jayson Tatum led the Celtics in scoring with 27 points, and a total of 6 Celtics ended in double figures. They held the Miami Heat, a great 3-point shooting team, to only 30% from the behind the arc!'

b'The return of Marcus Smart led the Celtics to a blowout victory over the Heat! Smart was the key difference-maker - he had 24 points and was a great facilitator tonight, adding 12 assists and 9 rebounds. His defense on Jimmy Butler was also outstanding.'
b'for allowing me the opportunity to speak to the Disney employees who make all of our dreams come true and make sure our families have an amazing time at Disneyland!'

b'Today I was at the most magical place on earth, Disneyland, and it did not disappoint! I had so much fun with the Disney executive team. Thank you to SVP Operations of Disneyland Resort Patrick Finnegan, and the entire executive staff https://t.co/XYnJMyJ0az'
b'Jimmy Butler is the best two way player left in the Playoffs and he continues to dominate! He proved himself again last night scoring 41 points, 9 rebounds, 5 assists, and 4 steals.'
b'Seven guys ended the game in double figures. Wiggins, Thompson, Green, Looney & Porter Jr. were led by Steph Curry with 21 points & 12 rebounds.'
b'It was a total team victory for the Warriors tonight! They dominated the Mavericks 112-87 because their outstanding defense allowed them to play great offense.'

b'We also pray for the Buffalo and Laguna Woods communities; that they grow stronger and support one another.'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99m saddened & still shocked to hear of the shootings that occurred in Buffalo & Laguna Woods. There is no place for hate in this country, or world, period. b'We were so happy he made that bold statement and we went out and backed it up by winning another Championship. We put high expectations on ourselves, Coach Riley put high expectations on us as a team, and we loved every minute of it!'

b'We as the players embraced what Coach Riley predicted and I, as well as the entire team, came into training camp in the best shape ever. We loved that he put that pressure on us because no team had gone back-to-back in a long time.'

b'After the 1987 Finals Coach Riley didn\xe2\x80\x99t even give us time to celebrate what we accomplished because he went in front of all the Lakers fans and guaranteed we would win it again the following year.'
b'The Showtime players loved that our Coach Pat Riley had expectations of all of us as individuals and as a team. He pushed us to be great.'

b'We came back every season expecting not just to win, but to win NBA Championships. We put in the work in the off season, during the season in practice, and in games. The end result was going to the Finals 9 times in 12 years and winning 5 NBA Championships.'

b'Thank you to my Showtime teammates Kareem, Byron Scott, Coop, James Worthy, A.C. Green, Bob McAdoo, Mychal Thompson, Jamaal Wilkes, Kurt Rambis, Mitch Kupchak, Mike McGee, Wes Matthews, Jim Chones, Norm Nixon & many others for embracing greatness & the expectations placed on us.'

b'Today, we remind ourselves of his dream for justice as one nation, moving hand in hand, with courage and love. b'We must not let his work go in vain. People of color are\xc2\xa0deserving of respect and dignity.\xc2\xa0As we continue to make strides towards justice for all, we carry his legacy\xc2\xa0on our shoulders. The job is not done.'

b'Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Day is a perfect time to honor, remember and keep in mind that his mission still stands true today. He fearlessly led the charge to improve the lives of African-Americans in this country and for his sacrifice, we\xc2\xa0are forever grateful.'

b'A friend of Cookie and I for over 30 years, Joe Douglas, passed away yesterday. Joe managed Frankie Beverly for 36 years and will be sorely missed. He just helped Cookie and I celebrate our 30th anniversary in September.'

b'From the bottom of my heart, I want to thank all the grassroots HIV/AIDS organizations, global organizations, and HIV/AIDS activists for being on the frontlines and educating their communities, the world, and people like myself about this deadly disease. #WorldAIDSDay'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99ve made a lot of progress in 30 years, including removing the stigma around HIV/AIDS & making advancements in the medicine, which is better &easier to take. Thank you to the doctors, scientists, & researchers who are still working tirelessly to find a cure. #WorldAIDSDay'

b"Today is #WorldAIDSDay. It's not lost on me how fortunate I am to be able to live with HIV for the past 30 years considering so many innocent lives have been lost. Today, we honor them & their families. Because of them, I continue to do the work to raise awareness about HIV/AIDS."

b'If anybody deserves to be in the NBA Hall of Fame it\xe2\x80\x99s definitely Michael Cooper who had a 12-year playing career, was Defensive Player of the Year in 1987, and was named to the NBA All-Defensive First Team five times, and eight All-Defensive Teams overall. @ShowtimeCooper'

b'from addressing the never ending shade of the past to celebrating the hope of this country\xe2\x80\x99s new chapter. It touched all of us in a special way.'

b'Let\xe2\x80\x99s continue to educate our communities and loved ones. Prevention is key and those living with HIV can live long and healthy lives. There is still a lot of work to be done and I will continue to unite in the fight!'

b'While we continue to work toward a cure, it\xe2\x80\x99s important to continue to fight against HIV and AIDS and show support for people living with both. We have to stop the discrimination against people living with HIV because everyone is deserving of love and respect.'
b'I want to thank all of the HIV/AIDS community-based organizations for the important work they are doing for the those living with this virus in communities across the globe.'

b'In honor of World AIDS Day we remember all of those who have died from an HIV-related illnesses and AIDS. It is because of the work of incredible doctors and researchers across the world that I\xe2\x80\x99m alive to this day and I do not take my life for granted.'

b'RIP to the late great Cliff Robinson. Cliff was the key to the Portland Trailblazers going to two NBA Finals in 1990 and 1992. At 6\'10" he was so versatile at his size! Offensively, he could shoot from the outside and take you off the dribble.'
b'I am personally grateful for his friendship and Cookie and I are praying for his children and the entire Thompson family during this difficult time. May he rest in peace!'
b'He altered the perception of how the world viewed Black coaches being the first to win the 1984 NCAA National Championship. 97% of his players that stayed for four years earned their degree!'

b'He was a father figure and mentor to his own players, many other student-athletes, and professionals in the NBA and in the business world. He stood for what he believed in like when he walked off the court before a game against Boston College to boycott Proposition 48.'

b'The world has lost another icon. Hall of Fame Coach John Thompson was a basketball legend, pioneer, advisor, friend and all around incredible man. Coach Thompson had a heart for teaching and helped so many players become men.'

b'His continued work while battling colon cancer further shows his perseverance and determination. Cookie and I are praying for his wife and family during these difficult times. May he Rest In Peace. \xf0\x9f\x99\x8f\xf0\x9f\x8f\xbe'

b'His performance in Black Panther was groundbreaking and inspired people of all races and ages. It shattered box office records and proved that movies with predominantly Black casts have the ability to sell and impact lives around the world.'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99m shocked and saddened to hear about the passing of an incredible actor, leader, and man, Chadwick Boseman at the young age of 43. b'Representative Lewis, Reverend Vivian, may you both Rest In Peace.  Cookie and I send our thoughts and prayers to both the Lewis and Vivian families.'
b'Sacrificing his own body and freedom, Reverend C.T. Vivian never wavered in the fight for equality. His bravery helped ignite a movement that we are beneficiaries of today.'

b'He led sit ins, voter registration drives, created a college readiness program to support Black kids kicked out of school due to racism, and founded an anti-racism organization that monitored the KKK.'
b'A founding member of the Nashville Christian Leadership Conference, Reverend Vivian was an early Civil Rights organizer and Baptist minister.'

b'John Lewis dedicated his life to advancing our community and fought tirelessly for justice and equal treatment. It is because of his unwillingness to back down to discrimination and injustice that we have gotten this far.'

b'As a leader of SNCC, Representative Lewis was one of the youngest on the frontline for key moments of the Civil Rights movement like the March on Washington, March in Selma, and was an original freedom rider.'
b'The world lost two incredible leaders, icons, & men yesterday. Representative John Lewis & Reverend C.T. Vivian.'

b'Reclaiming and properly honoring Juneteenth as a national holiday to celebrate the freedom of all Black Americans in the United States is a win for all of America.'

b'Two and a half years following Lincoln\xe2\x80\x99s Emancipation Proclamation on June 19, 1865 Galveston, Texas was the last to receive the news that all enslaved people were free. Juneteenth today celebrates freedom, achievement, education, and self-advancement in the Black community.'

b'We are at a time where our entire nation has to face the ugly history of the United States of America. Systemic racism continues to deprive, harm, and hinder Black people. Juneteenth is the oldest nationally celebrated commemoration of the ending of slavery in the United States.'

b'These men are our fathers, sons, brothers, uncles, human beings treated inhumanely by those who are supposed to protect and serve. Where are we supposed to put the range of emotions we experience seeing black men die on video?'

b'George Floyd was clearly murdered by a Minneapolis police officer. How many times do we have to see black men killed on national television? This has been going on for entirely too long. We need to start seeing black people as human beings and not animals on the street.'

b'Let us use Dr. King as inspiration to continue to advance his mission of equality for all in our homes, workplaces, schools, communities, and in everything we do.'

b'I proudly carry Dr. King\xe2\x80\x99s baton and encourage others to do the same. He once said, \xe2\x80\x9cIf you can\xe2\x80\x99t fly then run, if you can\xe2\x80\x99t run then walk, if you can\xe2\x80\x99t walk then crawl, but whatever you do you have to keep moving forward.\xe2\x80\x9d'

b'I believe strongly in supporting my community by creating thousands of jobs, advancing education opportunities for students, & not only taking a seat at the table but ensuring there is a seat for those coming behind me.'

b'Dr. King taught us \xe2\x80\x9cNot everybody can be famous but everybody can be great because greatness is determined by service\xe2\x80\x9d. I strive to be great every day and live by this principle.'
b'As we celebrate Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., a martyr in the African-American community, let us not forget that he dedicated his life, and ultimately lost it, for the betterment of our community.'
b'May God bless you in this next year with unimaginable joy, love, and peace. Happy birthday my love! @cjbycookie \xf0\x9f\x8e\x81\xf0\x9f\x8e\x88\xe2\x9d\xa4\xef\xb8\x8f'

b'Cookie and I are praying for the Stern family, his lovely wife Dianne and sons Eric and Andrew. May God comfort you during this time. Our hearts go out to you!'

b'I remember one of my meetings with David in his NYC office working with him to improve the overall NBA and All Star Weekend. It was very special that he asked me and we were able to collaborate and make improvements.'

b'David Stern was such a history maker. When I announced in 1991 I had HIV, people thought they could get the virus from shaking my hand. When David allowed me to play in the 1992 All Star Game in Orlando and then play for the Olympic Dream Team, we were able to change the world.'

b'For 30 years as NBA Commissioner, David grew the NBA to become one of the most popular leagues in the world with his revolutionary ideas. He took the NBA Finals from tape delay to live games & then began every Sunday on CBS highlighting Larry Bird\xe2\x80\x99s Celtics & my Showtime Lakers.'

b'Cookie and I are devastated to hear about the passing of my longtime friend and former NBA Commissioner David Stern. A great man, husband, father, friend, businessman, and visionary, I loved and respected him.'

b'2020 is the year that everyone should strive to overdeliver in all aspects of life. For me, I will overdeliver as a CEO, husband, father, brother, friend, business partner, and to all of my clients. I\xe2\x80\x99m looking forward to a great year!'

b'Without Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., none of this would have been possible. It is on us to ensure his work is not in vain. I strive to do my part in helping the community as he believed \xe2\x80\x9cLife\xe2\x80\x99s most persistent and urgent question is what are you doing for others?\xe2\x80\x9d'

b'Dr. King believed \xe2\x80\x9cthe function of education is to teach one to think intensively and critically\xe2\x80\x9d. Understanding the access education can provide, I made it a mission to help thousands of minority students go to college or return to get their HS diploma, and pursue their dreams.'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99ve worked diligently to advance Dr. King\xe2\x80\x99s vision using the platform that I have been blessed with, such as providing employment to over 50,000 minorities across all of my businesses.'

b'Because of Dr. King I have been able to own my own business for over 30 years and allowed in spaces traditionally I would have been denied. I thank Dr. King for the opportunity to own sports franchises like the LA Dodgers, LA Sparks, and LAFC.'

b'Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was a catalyst for the black community. His dedication to obtaining equal rights for our community and sacrifice to ensure our voices were heard and doors were knocked down are the foundation for our advancement today.'
